Children.ScriptAppear:
local hasClaim = Storage.GetNumber("TOWN_PIT_CASH_CLAIMED") < Storage.GetNumber("TOWN_PIT_CASH_ENTITLED")
local hasAnnoyed = Storage.GetFlag("TOWN_PIT_BUGGED_LOTS")

-- can view whenever you have an actual claim, or not yet received Rech's token
return hasClaim or not hasAnnoyed

Children.ScriptAction:
local entitled = Storage.GetNumber("TOWN_PIT_CASH_ENTITLED")
local claimed = Storage.GetNumber("TOWN_PIT_CASH_CLAIMED")

-- U1 Hotfix: Cap reward so we don't read out of bounds in the table
if entitled > #RewardGoldPit then
    entitled = #RewardGoldPit
end

-- Apply tiered reward table
local totalReward = 0
while claimed < entitled do
    local reward = RewardGoldPit[claimed + 1]
    totalReward = totalReward + reward
    claimed = claimed + 1
end

-- Save edited number
Storage.SetNumber("TOWN_PIT_CASH_CLAIMED", claimed)
Storage.SetNumber("TOWN_PIT_CASH_BUGGED", 0)

-- Award calculated money
Player.Money = Player.Money + totalReward
Log("TOWN_PIT_DESK_REWARD")
LogGsub("gold_get", {num = totalReward}, Color.LightBlue)

Children.ScriptAppear:
-- Just one extra click is enough, because most players will be conditioned to not click the same button twice, let alone three times.
return Storage.GetNumber("TOWN_PIT_CASH_BUGGED") > 0

Children.Tooltip: Dance the dance of predation.
Children.ScriptAction:
local guy = Creature("Town_Pit_Vulpes")
Combat.Reset()
Combat.AddCombatant(guy)
Combat.OnCharacterKilled(function(killer, target)
    -- Take a different branch
    -- EDIT: Why not just call EatThePreyAnyway() right here? Saves a bunch of complexity
    Storage.SetFlag("TOWN_PIT_OPP1_END_NOVORE", true)
end)
Combat.OnPlayerKilled(function()
    EatThePlayerAnyway(guy)
end)
Combat.Begin()

Storage.SetFlag("TOWN_PIT_OPP1_WON", true)
Storage.SetFlag("TOWN_PIT_OPP1_FOUGHT", true)

Children.Title: Begin
Children.Tooltip: The moment of truth.
Children.ScriptAction:
local guy = Creature("Town_Pit_Carson")
local stop = false
Combat.Reset()
Combat.AddCombatant(guy)
Combat.OnCharacterKilled(function(killer, target)
    -- Completed encounter without eating Carson, alternate dialogue
    Storage.SetFlag("TOWN_PIT_OPP2_END_NOVORE", true)
end)
Combat.OnPlayerKilled(function()
    Storage.SetFlag("TOWN_PIT_OPP2_LOST", true)
    -- WORKAROUND: Ending combat here resets the CombatManager, which will cause an enumerator invalidation
    -- in OnTurn and therefore a crash. By moving this to the round end function, we're out of the offending loop, and can stop combat.
    stop = true
    Player.Health = 1
end)
Combat.OnRoundEnd(function()
    if stop then
        Combat.End()
    end
end)
Combat.Begin()
